Package com.mmaarten.mmcommands

Class MmCommandHandler

java.lang.Object
com.mmaarten.mmcommands.MmCommandHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor, org.bukkit.command.TabCompleter, org.bukkit.command.TabExecutor
public class MmCommandHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.bukkit.command.TabExecutor
The MmCommandHandler is an implementation of TabExecutor which takes care of the repetitive tasks.

Use PluginCommand.setExecutor(CommandExecutor) to link an MmCommandHandler to your base command.

created on 29/04/2021 by Mmaarten. Project: MmCommands

  • Constructor Details

    • MmCommandHandler

      public MmCommandHandler()

  • Method Details

    • useHelp

      @NotNull public @NotNull MmCommandHandler useHelp()
      Enable the help feature for this handler. This will allow the use of /<basecommand> help which will invoke printHelp(CommandSender, String, List, int).

      When enabled, all first-level subcommands are forbidden to use "help" as name or alias.

      Returns:
      this handler

    • generateTabCompletions

      @NotNull public @NotNull MmCommandHandler generateTabCompletions()
      Enable automatic tab completions for this handler. When enabled, the name of subcommands are automatically added to the completions. (If the CommandSender has access to that specific subcommand)
      Returns:
      this handler

    • runLastAllowed

      @NotNull public @NotNull MmCommandHandler runLastAllowed()
      Enable partial running for this handler.

      When enabled, the handler will call the last correctly matched subcommand even if it is followed by a subcommand the CommandSender does not have the required permissions for. Example given

      User enters the command /myplugin say bold Hello World!. The user has the permission to the say subcommand but is lacking the permission for the bold subcommand.

      • If partial running is not enabled on the handler for the /myplugin command, noPermission(CommandSender, MmCommandSignature) will be called and command execution will be cancelled.
      • If partial running is enabled, the say subcommand will be executed with arguments ["bold","Hello", "World!"]
      Returns:
      this handler

    • helpHeader

      @NotNull public @NotNull MmCommandHandler helpHeader​(@NotNull @NotNull java.lang.String header)
      Set the header to be added to every help menu page.

      Minecraft color codes can be used by using the & character as alternative color character. Multiple lines can be used by using the java newline character. Default: "----Help----"

      ! Only used in the default implementation of printHelp(CommandSender, String, List, int) !

      Parameters:
      header - the header
      Returns:
      this handler

    • amountOfCommandsPerHelpPage

      @NotNull public @NotNull MmCommandHandler amountOfCommandsPerHelpPage​(int amount)
      Set the amount of help entries listed on each help page. Default: 5

      ! Only used in the default implementation of printHelp(CommandSender, String, List, int) !

      Parameters:
      amount - the amount
      Returns:
      this handler

    • helpCommandPrefix

      @NotNull public @NotNull MmCommandHandler helpCommandPrefix​(@NotNull @NotNull java.lang.String commandPrefix)
      Set the prefix to use in the help menu. The string will be put in front of every help entry, not in front of the header. The last ChatColor code in this string will be the color used to display the command. Default: "&d"

      ! Only used in the default implementation of printHelp(CommandSender, String, List, int) !

      Parameters:
      commandPrefix - the command color
      Returns:
      this handler

    • helpArgumentSpacer

      @NotNull public @NotNull MmCommandHandler helpArgumentSpacer​(@NotNull @NotNull java.lang.String argumentSpacer)
      Set the spacer to use in between the command with possible subcommands and the arguments. The string will be used once in every help entry, not in the header.

      The last ChatColor code in this string will be the color used to display the arguments. Default: "&5"

      ! Only used in the default implementation of printHelp(CommandSender, String, List, int) !

      Parameters:
      argumentSpacer - the argument spacer
      Returns:
      this handler

    • helpDescriptionSpacer

      @NotNull public @NotNull MmCommandHandler helpDescriptionSpacer​(@NotNull @NotNull java.lang.String descriptionSpacer)
      Set the spacer to use in between the arguments and the description. The string will be used once in every help entry, not in the header.

      The last ChatColor code in this string will be the color used to display the description. Default: "&5"

      ! Only used in the default implementation of printHelp(CommandSender, String, List, int) !

      Parameters:
      descriptionSpacer - the description spacer
      Returns:
      this handler

    • addCommand

      @NotNull public @NotNull MmCommandHandler addCommand​(MmCommand command)
      Register a command to this handler. The command class has to be annotated by the MmCommandSignature annotation.

      Both the name and the aliases must be unique.

      Parameters:
      command - the command to add to this handler
      Returns:
      this handler

    • onCommand

      public boolean onCommand​(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.command.Command command, @NotNull @NotNull java.lang.String label, java.lang.String[] args)
      Executes the given command, returning its success.
      Specified by:
      onCommand in interface org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor
      Parameters:
      sender - Source of the command
      command - Command which was executed
      label - Alias of the command which was used
      args - Passed command arguments
      Returns:
      true if a valid command, otherwise false

    • onTabComplete

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> onTabComplete​(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender, @NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.command.Command command, @NotNull @NotNull java.lang.String label, java.lang.String[] args)
      Requests a list of possible completions for a command argument.
      Specified by:
      onTabComplete in interface org.bukkit.command.TabCompleter
      Parameters:
      sender - Source of the command. For players tab-completing a command inside of a command block, this will be the player, not the command block.
      command - Command which was executed
      label - The alias used
      args - The arguments passed to the command, including final partial argument to be completed and command label
      Returns:
      A List of possible completions for the final argument, or null to default to the command executor

    • noArguments

      protected boolean noArguments​(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender)
      Code to be ran when a player executes the base command this handler is linked to without any arguments.

      The return value determines whether or not the help menu should be printed.

      Parameters:
      sender - the sender
      Returns:
      whether or not to print the help menu to the player

    • noSuchCommand

      protected boolean noSuchCommand​(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender, @NotNull @NotNull java.lang.String attemptedCommand)
      Code to be ran when a player executes the base command this handler is linked to with arguments but the first argument cannot be resolved to a command or to an alias.

      The return value determines whether or not the help menu should be printed.

      Parameters:
      sender - the sender
      attemptedCommand - the command the player attempted to invoke (first argument)
      Returns:
      whether or not to print the help menu to the player

    • noValidType

      protected boolean noValidType​(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender, @NotNull @NotNull MmCommandSignature signature)
      Code to be ran when a player executes a command they are not allowed to run because of the commandtype. This will only be called on commands directly registered to this handler as any subcommand is of type MmCommandType.SUB_COMMAND which poses no restrictions.

      The return value determines whether or not the help menu should be printed.

      Parameters:
      sender - the sender
      signature - the signature of the invoked command
      Returns:
      whether or not to print the help menu to the player

    • noPermission

      protected boolean noPermission​(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender, @NotNull @NotNull MmCommandSignature signature)
      Code to be ran when a player executes a command they do not have the required permission node for.

      The return value determines whether or not the help menu should be printed.

      Parameters:
      sender - the sender
      signature - the signature of the invoked command
      Returns:
      whether or not to print the help menu to the player

    • printHelp

      protected void printHelp​(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.command.CommandSender commandSender, @NotNull @NotNull java.lang.String label, @NotNull @NotNull java.util.List<MmCommand> commands, int page)
      Print the help menu to the provided commandsender. The help menu consists of the header followed by a specified amount of help entries. Each entry follows this pattern: commandPrefix /label [subcommand(s)] argumentSpacer arguments descriptionSpacer description A help entry will be added for all MmCommands that match at least one of the following conditions:
      • The command signature has a non-empty string for the arguments property
      • The command does not have any subcommands
      Parameters:
      commandSender - the command sender
      label - the label
      commands - the commands
      page - the page
